Package com.pantgwyn.objectsort

Class WorkFile<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pantgwyn.objectsort.WorkFile<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The class of objects being sorted
    public class WorkFile<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    A encapsulation of the work files used by ObjectSort.

    An instance of WorkFile is created for every sort work file required (if any) to perform the sort. The work files are only used if the sort cannot be completed in memory.

    Author:
    Dave Breeze

      • getCurrentInputItem

        public T getCurrentInputItem()
        Get the last object that was read by this WorfFile
        Returns:
        Object of class T that is the currently read object for the WorkFile or null if end of file reached

      • startInStream

        public java.io.ObjectInputStream startInStream()
                                        throws java.io.IOException,
                                               java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Start the InputStream for this WorkFile

        Called at the start of a file merge to ready the WorkFile for reading.

        Returns:
        ObjectInputStream of the WorkFile.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • startOutStream

        public java.io.ObjectOutputStream startOutStream()
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Start the OutputStream for this WorkFile

        Called when a sort cannot be completed in memory. Makes the WorkFile ready to receive objects.

        Returns:
        ObjectOutputStream of the WorkFile.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getNextInput

        public void getNextInput()
                  throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Read the next object from the WorKFile.

        Called in merge processing. The next object is read and currentInputItem is updated.

        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • deleteFile

        public void deleteFile()
        Delete the file from the io system

        Called at the end of a merge process to ensure that all created work files are removed from the i/o subsystem.
